Abstract: This study investigates the application of predictive models in understanding disease pathways and trajectories, with a focus on personalized medicine. By leveraging machine learning algorithms and time series analysis, we aim to identify key factors contributing to health deterioration and develop tailored interventions. Our analysis reveals that digital health pathways play a crucial role in predicting disease progression, and that incorporating artificial intelligence can enhance the accuracy of disease trajectory forecasting. The findings of this research have significant implications for the development of personalized medicine approaches, enabling healthcare providers to make data-driven decisions and provide targeted interventions. By integrating machine learning and time series analysis, we can improve patient outcomes and enhance the overall effectiveness of healthcare systems.
